intro: Gomphrena lutea, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its bright yellow, spherical flower heads that resemble small globes, which are composed of numerous tiny, papery petals. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, and it is well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, and the stems are often branched and covered in fine hairs. Gomphrena lutea is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
